intro: Megastachya berteroniana, commonly known as the Mexican torchflower, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, orange-red flowers resembling torches, which bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a notable addition to botanical collections.
